snippet: Some experts say a contract for two million doses of a treatment for a disease eradicated in 1980 has the government paying too high a price for too much of a new medicine.
abstract: Federal government is buying new smallpox drug from Siga Technologies to treat two million people in event of bioterrorism attack; $463 million purchase sets off debate about lucrative contract, with some experts saying government is buying too much of drug at too high a price.
lead_paragraph: Some experts say a contract for two million doses of a treatment for a disease eradicated in 1980 has the government paying too high a price for too much of a new medicine.

headline.seo: U.S. Stockpiles Smallpox Drug in Case of Bioterror Attack
headline.main: Wary of Attack With Smallpox, U.S. Buys Up a Costly Drug
headline.print_headline: U.S. Buys Smallpox Drug, but Some Question Cost
